creator: vincent@icarian.com
text:
not sure how to explain this:
here is my original configuration file:
log4j.rootCategory=ERROR, A1
log4j.appender.A1.File=d:/Dev/CurrentLine/logs/Icariannoport.log
log4j.appender.A1=org.apache.log4j.FileAppender
log4j.appender.A1.layout.ConversionPattern=%-.1p %d{yyMMdd HHmmss} %-8.8c{1} %-
8.8u %e %m\n
log4j.appender.A1.layout=icarian.util.IcPatternLayout

as you can see , i was originally using the root category settings for all 
categories.

then i wanted to log some specific stuff so i added the following:
log4j.category.icarian.startup.IcEngine=ERROR, A3
log4j.appender.A3=org.apache.log4j.FileAppender
log4j.appender.A3.File=d:/Dev/CurrentLine/logs/Applogic.log
log4j.appender.A3.layout.ConversionPattern=%-.1p %d{yyMMdd HHmmss} %-8.8c{1} %-
8.8u %e %m\n
log4j.appender.A3.layout=icarian.util.IcPatternLayout

with this setting, i get this from the jvm:
Can't find class icarian/startup/IcEngine

once i change the appender to this:
log4j.category.icarian.startup=ERROR, A3

basically removing "IcEngine", everything is fine.

or once i don't add that whole block for IcEngine, and let the application get 
started, then i add the whole block back, everything is cool.


so to summarize, if i spell out the full qualified name as my category name, 
the jvm is having problems loading that class, if i remove the settings in the 
configuration file and start it up then put the settings back in then i get the 
expected behavior. also truncating the actual class name out and just using the 
package name as the category name then everything works.
any help would be appreciated.
thanks,
vincent

creator: bugzilla@apache.org
text:
Log4j just not assume that the name of a category is a class class name. There 
is no way how a name of a category could influence class loading. That is just 
impossible. 

There is something else that you are doing independently of log4j configuration. 
Thanks, Ceki
